page.title: 05Agriculture
page.content: 1 Mr Hoopers Farm. 566 acres, 3 Full-time workers, one part-time. They start at 7.00 a.m. and finish at approx 8.00 p.m. He has 80 to 90 cows milked at 5.30 a.m. in the morning and 2.30 p..m. in the afternoon. Forty chickens and a bull. Five tractors, two pick-up trucks and one car. Cardinal Morton was born in his farm house and was buried in Bere Regis when he was ninety. Mr. Hooper has been farming since he was born and goes to race meetings in his spare time. Other things grown on the farm include wheat and barley and he makes silage. The farm is called Manor Farm. 2. Goulds Farm. Mr. Miller owns this farm and it has 525 acres, two full time workers, they work from 7.30 a.m. in the morning and finish at 5.30 p.m. if busy 8.00 p.m. He has 250 beef cattle, 600 sheep, five Ford tractors,
